content.raw:
To complete the migration:

 * Implement s3 repository clean up. Issue #34
 * Do we need to modify the destination of the doc generating scripts? Currently using old.gazebosim.org. Issue #35

content.raw:
Just the package name seems fine to me. In that case, is there anything to change.

I don't have another suggestion at this time.
content.html:
Just the package name seems fine to me. In that case, is there anything to change.

I don't have another suggestion at this time.

content.raw:
We can try to use just the package name (gazebo3, gazebo3-prerelease, gazebo4, gazebo5 all of them will use just gazebo) which is the option currently implemented in this Pull Request.

Other schemas could end up in some nicer organization but would probably be harder to maintain. Other ideas are easy to maintain are very welcome.
content.html:
We can try to use just the package name (gazebo3, gazebo3-prerelease, gazebo4, gazebo5 all of them will use just gazebo) which is the option currently implemented in this Pull Request.

Other schemas could end up in some nicer organization but would probably be harder to maintain. Other ideas are easy to maintain are very welcome.

Okay. Slight change.

1. `http://gazebosim.org/osrf-distributions` is dead.

1. Use only `http://gazebosim.org/distributions` to access everything.

For example

`http://gazebosim.org/distributions/gazebo/releases/gazebo-1.0.1.tar.bz2`

update.title: Initial work on s3_upload

content.raw:
Making the question a bit wiser, which is the name schema to follow to upload files from release.py to the s3 container?

Note that the release.py script usually know about: package_name (gazebo3, ign-transport, ...), version, package_alias (gazebo3-prerelease, ignition-transport, ...), OSRF bitbucket URL or ignitionrobotics bitbucket URL.
content.html:
Making the question a bit wiser, which is the name schema to follow to upload files from release.py to the s3 container?

Note that the release.py script usually know about: package_name (gazebo3, ign-transport, ...), version, package_alias (gazebo3-prerelease, ignition-transport, ...), OSRF bitbucket URL or ignitionrobotics bitbucket URL.

content.raw:
ok, thanks. I found them and [updated the ignition formulae](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/commit/6295cce3f347e4c32c2c3777f1f97de41a839ecf)

Note that I had trouble finding the ignition tarballs because they aren't listed in the xml file returned from https://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com
content.html:
ok, thanks. I found them and updated the ignition formulae

Note that I had trouble finding the ignition tarballs because they aren't listed in the xml file returned from https://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com

content.html: We are using s3://osrf-distributions/$PACKAGE/releases/ to store the generated .deb files. Which should be the destination for the generated release tarballs?

content.html: I need to update the release.py to include the new donwload URL and the new sc3cmd method to upload tarballs. Working on it now.

content.html: they are under ignition/releases

content.raw: Thanks! I'll update the homebrew formulae
content.html: Thanks! I'll update the homebrew formulae

content.raw:
You have two options:

1. https://gazebosim.org/distributions/<SOME_GAZEBO_FILE>
1. https://gazebosim.org/osrf-distributions/<FULL PATH TO SOME FILE>

Example for 1:

`http://gazebosim.org/distributions/gazebo-1.0.0.tar.bz2`

Example for 2:

`http://gazebosim.org/osrf-distributions/sdformat/releases/libsdformat-dev_1.4.11-1~saucy_i386.deb`
content.html:
You have two options:

  1. https://gazebosim.org/distributions/<SOME_GAZEBO_FILE>;
  2. https://gazebosim.org/osrf-distributions/<FULL PATH TO SOME FILE>

Example for 1:

http://gazebosim.org/distributions/gazebo-1.0.0.tar.bz2

Example for 2:

http://gazebosim.org/osrf-distributions/sdformat/releases/libsdformat-dev_1.4.11-1~saucy_i386.deb

content.html: Nice! if you can sync the current repo, I believe that we can start submitting new packages/tarballs to s3 and we can forget about the scp method.

content.raw: New distributions list: [http://gazebosim.org/distributions](http://gazebosim.org/distributions)
content.html: New distributions list: http://gazebosim.org/distributions

content.raw: Yeah. That's a s3 thing. Their webinterface will by default show either an index.html, or the first txt file in a directory. We'll need to write our own listing.
content.html: Yeah. That's a s3 thing. Their webinterface will by default show either an index.html, or the first txt file in a directory. We'll need to write our own listing.

content.raw: Currently it resolves to the installation shell script.
content.html: Currently it resolves to the installation shell script.

content.raw: Yup, it goes to the gazebo distributions. We'll have to add something to the OSRF website if we want the same capability there. The OSRF web maintenance is out of my control.
content.html: Yup, it goes to the gazebo distributions. We'll have to add something to the OSRF website if we want the same capability there. The OSRF web maintenance is out of my control.

content.raw: http://gazebosim.org/distributions doesn't resolve to the same place as s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions
content.html: http://gazebosim.org/distributions doesn't resolve to the same place as s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions

content.raw: Go ahead and merge this.
content.html: Go ahead and merge this.

content.raw: The s3 container is already synced. I plan on keeping the `old.gazebosim.org/assets/distribtions` for a while as a backup. I'll email the gazebo mailing list following this pull request.
content.html: The s3 container is already synced. I plan on keeping the old.gazebosim.org/assets/distribtions for a while as a backup. I'll email the gazebo mailing list following this pull request.

content.raw:
ook, I think that we don't need to modify anything in this pull request, right?

My point is: we should sync the s3 container with all our current releases now in assets/, mail gazebosim so our downstream developers know about the new location and merge this pull request. From that moment on, we will consider the old assets/ dead and only use the s3 container.
content.html:
ook, I think that we don't need to modify anything in this pull request, right?

My point is: we should sync the s3 container with all our current releases now in assets/, mail gazebosim so our downstream developers know about the new location and merge this pull request. From that moment on, we will consider the old assets/ dead and only use the s3 container.

content.raw: We can't create an alias to `s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions`, we can only do `s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions` which doesn't seem to useful. Instead, I created `http://gazebosim.org/distributions` that points to `s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions`.
content.html: We can't create an alias to s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions, we can only do s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions which doesn't seem to useful. Instead, I created http://gazebosim.org/distributions that points to s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions.

content.raw: @gerkey Can you add an A-record to osrfoundation.org, maybe distributions.osrfoundation.org, that points to s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions?
content.html: @gerkey Can you add an A-record to osrfoundation.org, maybe distributions.osrfoundation.org, that points to s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions?

content.raw: Sounds good to me.
content.html: Sounds good to me.

content.raw: Bump: could we create a subdomain of osrfoundation.org that we alias to s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions so we don't have to change all the links again if/when we stop using s3?
content.html: Bump: could we create a subdomain of osrfoundation.org that we alias to s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions so we don't have to change all the links again if/when we stop using s3?

content.raw:
The shrub.appspot.com is just for viewing files via the web. You can get any file using https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/<rest_of_the_path

Please create another pull request to fix the homebrew formulae.
content.html:
The shrub.appspot.com is just for viewing files via the web. You can get any file using https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/<rest_of_the_path

Please create another pull request to fix the homebrew formulae.

content.raw:
What is the official URL that we will be replacing it with? I see the following when I browse to the s3 bucket:

http://shrub.appspot.com/osrf-distributions/

Should we make a subdomain of osrfoundation.org that we use for our official links?

There's still references to gazebosim.org/assets/distributions in [homebrew formulae](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation) and probably other places as well.
content.html:
What is the official URL that we will be replacing it with? I see the following when I browse to the s3 bucket:

http://shrub.appspot.com/osrf-distributions/

Should we make a subdomain of osrfoundation.org that we use for our official links?

There's still references to gazebosim.org/assets/distributions in homebrew formulae and probably other places as well.

content.raw: The plan is to start using s3, but keep old.gazebosim.org up and running until we feel comfortable taking it down. I imagine we'd keep old.gazebosim.org running until the DRC contract ends.
content.html: The plan is to start using s3, but keep old.gazebosim.org up and running until we feel comfortable taking it down. I imagine we'd keep old.gazebosim.org running until the DRC contract ends.

content.raw: @nkoenig what is the plan to sync the new repo and deprecate the old.gazebosim.org domain? We will need the URL pointing to s3 before merging this or release.py won't work.
content.html: @nkoenig what is the plan to sync the new repo and deprecate the old.gazebosim.org domain? We will need the URL pointing to s3 before merging this or release.py won't work.
